review_title: Mission driven organization w/ good work life balance
job_title: Student Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Good work life balance Nice people Reasonable workload
cons: Could be more efforts to create sense of community within the HQ staff office

job_title: Student Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Had a great student assistant job. Good salary, nice people, good benefits, and they helped me network and find out what to do for my master's
cons: Too big workload, had tendency not to respect my private hours, but was still a good and nice environment

job_title: Communications Specialist in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Kind workspace Care about employee health Workload is manageable
cons: wage is average could have more common spaces

job_title: Global Advisor in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Strong on values and ambition
cons: Weak in making principles work in reality

job_title: Freelancer Translator in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: I worked for DRC's Translation service. Always professional collaboration.
cons: Closed in 2021 as a part of cuts

job_title: Head of Internal Audit in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
The DRC is objectively a great place to work. There might be some flaws, or things that gets you upset, but overall you are:
- given a lot of responsibilities for shaping the organization.
- allowed to try, sometimes making mistake but nobody keeps count.
- excellent work-life balance.
- exciting sector where you feel you make a difference in the world.
- fair pay and good economic conditions.
- excellent working conditions.
cons: - Management sometimes is hesitant in taking decisions which makes you at times feel like you are aboard a ship without much of a captain

job_title: Project Coordinator in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: amazing colleagues - respect - support - motivation
cons: higher salaries to compensate for the high cost of living in CPH are desirable

review_title: A place to become aware of the world
job_title: Student Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
Day to day connection to humanitarian related matters ( crisis, outplacement, refugees )
A place to grow professionally
A place to explore your potential and build skills
cons: Contracts are based on the donors' funding

review_title: Good place to have a job for the greater good
job_title: Senior Consultant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Be surrounded by special people, with high values. Plenty of flexibility. Serving the greater good.
cons: Processes requires optimization and it can ger frustrating at times

job_title: Grants Management Specialist in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
- Flexibility
- Stability
- Challenging
- Friendly environment
cons: Sometimes they seem to forget that their workforce is not only made by Danish people

job_title: HR- Consultant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: team support and purpose of the organization
cons: workload might be a lot to handle

job_title: Graduate Student in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: A place with opportunity to grow and learn
cons: There isn't much diversity and inclusivity

job_title: Student Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Colleagues, Good benefits in DK, central office, english working language, international but yet very Danish (could be a con as well depending on what you look for)
cons: Sometimes high work load, sometimes hard to break through to still very Danish side of company as international, not a lot of outside of work activities, internal mobility felt limited

job_title: International Business Controller in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Very friendly environment, good colleagues, feel like at home, you're welcomed.
cons: It can get a little chaotic sometimes.

review_title: Thank you for the learning and guidance
job_title: IT Student Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
As a student, I was treated like a full time employee and my opinions were taken into consideration during team discussions. A friendly work environment and one has the freedom to explore their interests provided it also benefits the company.

A growing company in terms of IT, so there are a lot of opportunities for one to learn and contribute.
cons: Not much as long as you are okay with the pay.

review_title: Great working environment at HQ level
job_title: Project Officer in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
Great colleagues with an inclusive approach to work.
OK organisational development and strategy, albeit going slightly corporate.
cons:
HQ consists of many great leaders, although some have not been in the field very much, which can sometimes be sensed in the organisational development. 
Field staff should be more included in organisational development and goals.

job_title: Contractor in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: NGO has one of the best reputations in the world and that is reflected in vthe very high standards work is held to. Senior staff are extremely dedicated. Complex mutli-sectoral interventions, dynamic and ambitious programming.
cons: Internal systems are not perfect; communications (internal and external) could use some work.

review_title: Deployed at short notice as emergency staff to support humanitarian crisis in 40+ locations
job_title: Global Emergency Specialist in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Amazing colleagues. Dedicated, hard working professionals operating in difficult locations.  DRC very supportive wherever possible.
cons: Many locations not compatible with family life.  High staff turnover negatively impacts continuity and consistency of work.

job_title: Human Resources in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Highly professional organisation, with great momentum and exciting things ahead.
cons: The organization is a bit siloed in regions.

job_title: Head of Section in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros:
Positive attitude of colleagues
High responsibilization and trust
High professionalism
cons: Very flat organization where decision making processes are unclear and sometimes excessively time consuming.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Work life balance is highly encouraged, there is significant growth in career and there is equal opportunity globally.
cons: Not that I know of

job_title: Administration in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Nice work environment, great colleagues and great to work for an Organization with high values.
cons: No much to say here

review_title: Great for working aside your studies
job_title: Assistant in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: Lots of responsibility and a good course
cons: A certain amount of admin as well

job_title: Finance, Human Resources and Administrative Manager in Copenhagen, Capital Region
pros: DRC uses Web based applications.
cons: Inconsistencies application of procedures  between different field offices.
